entries.title: Goldman Sachs is planning to cut up to 8% of its employees in January
entries.description: The planning is ongoing, and the round could be smaller than that, according to the person, who declined to be identified speaking about personnel decisions.

entries.title: Binance's native BNB token plunges to lowest since July as concerns mount about withdrawals, FTX ties
entries.description: Crypto exchange giant Binance, the firm that would potentially bail out FTX, is facing its own questions now, and investors are selling out of its native coin.

entries.title: Bill Gates-backed nuclear demonstration project in Wyoming delayed because Russia was the only fuel source
entries.description: Terrapower's advanced nuclear plant design, known as Natrium, relies on HALEU uranium.

entries.title: Amazon workers will go on formal strike for the first time in the UK
entries.description: Employees at Amazon's Coventry warehouse in central England voted Friday to go on strike.

entries.title: Omicron boosters are 84% effective at keeping seniors from being hospitalized with Covid, CDC says
entries.description: U.S. health officials have focused in particular on making sure older adults stay up to date on their Covid vaccines.

entries.title: 'Avatar: The Way of Water' makes $17 million in Thursday previews, driven by big 3D sales
entries.description: James Cameron's "Avatar: The Way of Water" snared $17 million during early screenings on its way toward a $175 million opening weekend.

entries.title: Treasury's financial stability watchdog says fraud is rampant in crypto markets
entries.description: The crypto currency market is rife with fraud, failures to comply with existing laws and big swings in volatility, Treasury's financial stability watchdog said.

entries.title: Central banks around the world have now given the markets a clear message — tighter policy is here to stay
entries.description: The U.S. Federal Reserve, European Central Bank, Bank of England and Swiss National Bank all raised interest rates by 50 basis points this week.

entries.title: EU threatens Elon Musk with sanctions after Twitter's suspension of journalists
entries.description: The European Union on Friday threatened tech billionaire Elon Musk with sanctions after Twitter removed several journalists that report on him.

entries.title: Former FTX spokesman Kevin O'Leary defends endorsement of Bankman-Fried's crypto firm
entries.description: Kevin O'Leary appeared on CNBC's Squawk Box to address his Senate testimony and his sponsorship deal with FTX, trading barbs with CNBC's anchors.

entries.title: Advertisers will return to Twitter if a few core conditions are met, ad guru says
entries.description: Global advertising guru Maurice Levy said Friday that the majority of advertisers are likely to return to Elon Musk's overhauled Twitter — on the proviso that a few conditions are met.

entries.title: Amazon signs deal to bring fantasy game Warhammer to screens
entries.description: Amazon will produce film and television series based on franchises from Games Workshop, the company behind the popular Warhammer tabletop game.

entries.title: Neobanks battle to lure UK savers with juicy yields as interest rates rocket to a 14-year high
entries.description: Online banks in the U.K. are bumping up the yields on their savings accounts after the Bank of England increased interest rates for the ninth time in a year.

entries.title: Russian central bank holds key rate at 7.5%, warns inflation risks are 'prevailing'
entries.description: Russia's central bank on Friday held its key interest rate at 7.5% for a second consecutive meeting.

entries.title: No signs of crypto spilling over into traditional assets – yet, analyst says
entries.description: There are "no signs of spillover" from cryptocurrency into more traditional assets, according to an investment analyst from AJ Bell.

entries.title: BP invests millions in company that supplies 'rapidly deployable' solar tech
entries.description: Energy major says investment in 5B wraps up a Series B funding round of 55 million Australian dollars.

entries.title: Planned wind farm told it will need to shut down for five months a year to protect parrots
entries.description: If built, the project could have as many as 122 wind turbines.

entries.title: How this millennial CEO steered the world's largest vaccine maker during the pandemic
entries.description: Adar Poonawalla became the CEO of the world's largest vaccine manufacturer, Serum Institute of India, when he was 30 years old.

entries.title: China’s sudden ‘reopening’ reveals new challenges as infections soar
entries.description: Mainland China's swift rollback of many Covid-related restrictions has been unexpectedly sudden, revealing a new set of economic challenges.
